meanings.sent1: I accidentally outbake the cookies and they turned too crispy.
meanings.sent2: She always outbakes the bread, making it perfectly golden brown.
meanings.sent3: When I outbake the cake, it becomes as hard as a rock!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbake everyone else in the baking competition was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the outbaked pie filled the entire kitchen.

meanings.sent1: He managed to outbake his sister in making the best muffins.
meanings.sent2: The professional baker always strives to outbake his own previous creations.
meanings.sent3: It was a friendly competition to see who could outbake the other in making cupcakes.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outbake others was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of her outbaked pastries drew customers from afar.

meanings.sent1: She would outbake her friends by preparing multiple batches of cookies.
meanings.sent2: During the holidays, she would outbake everyone in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The challenge was to outbake each other in creating the most delicious desserts.
meanings.sent4: He decided to outbake the competition by baking throughout the night.
meanings.sent5: The bakery would outbake all others in town with their wide variety of treats.
